result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mackenzie Jeron Moore

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Mackenzie Jeron Moore.  Assistant District Attorney Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  WITH THE COURT'S PERMISSION, THIS MATTER WAS SCHEDULED OFF THE RECORD.  Defense requests a final pre trial and jury trial.  Case remains calendared in Br 45. mn.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 12 pages) commencing 09-09-2022 by Kristin Menzia.

Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Mackenzie Jeron Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Bender . State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Sargent unavailable for court on the date of  8/23/22, and requested the date of 9/9/22 at 1:30.  With the courts consent and for good cause, the Court will grant the new date.  mn

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent not in court, defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Sargent was recently appointed but was unable to appear in court.  With the court's approval, this matter is adjourned for preliminary hearing in preliminary court.   mn  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed

Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with LNC, TH, DM, LM, JM (mother of victims)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Mackenzie Jeron Moore in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mackenzie Jeron Moore appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
